Reviews.Title: “dont bother go there”
Reviews.Author: leoniesilva
Reviews.Content: the place was filthy 1. Dirty towels 2. Dirty bed sheets 3. Broken telephone 4. Several other visitors always complaining 5. Run down dirty apartment 6. Broken AC which was also not fixed 7.construction work in next door apartment which we were not informed about. This started from 8am, meaning we did not get much rest. This work will continue until may 2012. Staff indicated that these are ongoing problems and therefore there will be several unsatisfied customers.

Reviews.Title: “Woogo Central Park : go for the location, fight for a good unit.”
Reviews.Author: Barrio-Management
Reviews.Content: It is my first option in New York for location, first of all, and rates. I love the area and I take use the red line (1,2,3) and get everywhere in minutes from the 72nd stop. Units come with a furnished kitchen, tv, and private bathroom, so you can shop at Trader Joe's, Faraway or even Zabars' and keep hundreds of dlls in your pocket if you want to cook and relax at home, or even have a great deal at Gray's Papaya ¨(check the recession special...): but if you shop and don't look at prices, you could even spend more than ina restaurant when going for cheese, import food, etc. Close to Central Park and Broadway, what else do you need? A good room : this is when you have to start a decent fight with the person in charge and try to give a look at as many units as possible till you won't recognize the unit as shown in the pictures. They will also ask a 100 Usd deposit , charged at your credit card upon arrival but canceled when you alredy left (I dind't like it) , and will take a copy of your credit card and your Id (I didn't like!). But charges have been as agreed. All together, I would recommend it when booking via their website.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Woogo”
Reviews.Author: Xeniaarce
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this was an amazing trip especially being from Orange County CA, it's a great city, very different from our hometown. My boyfriend and I decided to spend 4 nights and 5 days at Woogo and for the price why not? The only thing I found great about Woogo was the location. It was very close to central park and times square not to mention in a safe area. now where do I begin with my bad review.. First of all the people in the front desk on the first floor are very unfriendly when u go in to the check in the office is a dump. The elevators are pretty old then just when u think the worst is over you walk into your room and find the windows don't close, there is a very bad smell in the sheets the restroom is small and dirty, no cable, the towels are so rough and tiny as if they were meant for children, u never see an employee so good luck getting new towels or room service. And if you are not convinced yet we had bites all over most likely bed bug bites we were itchy through out the day and night. Stay away

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, bare bones amenities in this upper West side apt.”
Reviews.Author: Ptowngirl1616
Reviews.Content: If you have low expectations in the dorm apt. furniture, iron, but no ironing board, flat screen TV but no remote, heater, but 'it don't work', toilet paper, but only a half roll, a 2 burner stove and only 1 of the 2 burners works....if this doesn't bother you, you'll be fine! The location can't be beat-lots of great restaurants and shops around, Metro a block away.....and it's cheap! Try it once, then treat yourself to a nicer place the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service but this has the basic essentials”
Reviews.Author: dinh-traveler
Reviews.Content: where do i start? I'll start with the pros first, the list is shorter but honest: This an apartment suite with basic essentials. Two girlfriends and I shared a bedroom bachelor room with a pull-out sofa. It has a simple kitchen with all the Ikea dishware and utensils. Simple hot stove with microwave and working mini-fridge. I was impressed with how clean the bathroom was. There is decent closet as well for your coats and shoes. Plenty of clean sheets/materials and drawers for yoru clothes. Everything is clean enough and it's perfect when you're on a budget vacation. It is right by one of the subway stations on the upper west side. Location is perfect to get to anywhere you need. I love this location because it is right by central park and this area is clean, convenient and quiet. We personally wanted to stay around from the busiest parts of nyc and we didnt mind a bit of travel. Taxis are always available around this area including plenty of places to eat. Anything you need or want you must ask for yourself or go to the main office directly on the second floor. The front door/foyer is wonderful and it's a nice small place to hang out if needed. Now, for some reason, our room had a difficult heater/ac. Perhaps the previous tenants messed it up or it has not be looked at in a while. A repair man did come up to our room to try & fix it but he said it would not be an easy fix. Other rooms were filled so we just HAD to deal with it for the rest of our trip. Luckily, we were outside throughout our entire trip and the ac still worked. the only problem was that it was noisy and the earplugs didnt help with the sleep. They usually have enough essentials and they are usually quite polite and respectful. It's only their services that need work. Any little thing you need, whether it's toilet paper or towels, you must go to them directly. anything we asked for we had to ask twice, especially if it was over the phone. would i come back? Not to this particular place. I would look somewhere else a bit cheaper or with better services. This is not a hotel so i had no big expectations. The location is truly fantastic in my opinion and that completely made my trip comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “awful But we had fun anyway”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: A friend from work and I went to NYC for a get away. The booked the Woogo Tempo because it was close to the park and I like the Upper West Side. I paid extra for a bigger room, and when we got there they were sold out of the bigger rooms, even though I paid in advance, we were stuck two guys having to share a double bed. Our view was great of the Ansoma building a huge Gothic amazing upper scale condo stucture next door, which hosted Continetal Baths years ago in the cellar ) ok the Better Midler/ Barry Mandilow thing sorry.) So with our tiny room with a dirty microwave and tiny sink pending to be the "kitchenette" we managed. The computer access box did not work even though we also were charged for it.The bathroom was small, needed an upgrade, and there was no room to even walk around the bed, it was really bad. IT was a neck stain to watch the tv which loomed ontop of a shabby high top dresser a foot from the side of the bed. You litterary had to exit the bed out of the end not the side!Our luggage was stored until check in , thrown in a closet with everyone elses bags, no tags or tickets, just which one is Yours! wow. very nervous. An elevator that was in need of repair, and all of the customers were complaining about everything. We laughed it off, but I really should have booked something else. I was embarrassed I was hosting my friend's first trip to NYC! my gosh. The subway was right outside our door feel the shake, and Central Park we could walk to, but it was a very dark lit street at night, and the staff changed shifts so much, no one knew that we were actually guests. No security to speak of, anyone could have just walked in. It was not that cheap either, I have since found other hotels that are much better. They have gone through a bit of a reno, when we were there there was drilling and scaffolding all up the front of the building and stairs. They could have given us something for inconvienace, but they Really did not seem to care or even speak English. Not even a smile, and it seemed if you had a question at the desk, they were eating something and ignored you. Not impressed. The lobby decor was also hiddeous, even my unwordly friend laughed at it. WE did see a couple shows and rented bycyles in the park, and enjoyed spring. I did not like this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find a bargain in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: caratstone
Reviews.Content: This is an older property, but served my purpose. Needed this area, and the location at Broadway and 73rd can't be beat. Close to shops, food, and subway. I was with another couple so room became reasonably priced when we split the cost. We were able to get a 1 bedroom rate on a two bedroom apartment. They only have a few of these (with no sitting area) which is better than taking a normal 1 bedroom with pullout couch in living area. The two bedrooms each had TV. Kitchenette was helpful. Couldn't check in till 3 which was annoying, but we could leave our bags. On check out told them we need to leave our bags for about 2 hours, and they wanted $5 each...I complained and they let us just leave them. Not luxury, but would likely stay there again. Note that the name of the "hotel" is not listed outside, so when you pull up to the address it can be very confusing. You go in, find the elevator and take it to the 2nd floor room that serves as check-in/office.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: Johann M
Reviews.Content: The place is very good situated. You have direct connection to the subway, where all the main lines stop. The room was clean and quite. The staff was friendly and the sourrounding area was safe. The price was too high, but to this time was the New York Marathon, where all other prices were high as well. Close to the appartement is a store called "Trader Joe" where you can find your food for a good price. Dont expect, that the stuff is cleaning your room every day, but our room was clean and everything worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there”
Reviews.Author: marianna g
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Woogo. When we arrived late at night, we had to wait at the reception for about 30 minutes just to get our key. We were up on the 16th floor. We had a fully equipped kitchen, two chairs but no table! How were we expected to eat our breakfast i do not know. Are tables so expensive in America? Otherwise they were quite helpful and nice except for our pre-booked taxi by them to JFK which cost us much more than we thought. I would not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Woogo!”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas G
Reviews.Content: Woogo is probably the worst Apartment Rental agency ever. My friends booked an apartment with them in August 2011. I had to call twice to get a written confirmation from the agency, and when they finally decided to send it, neither the number of nights nor the way to get the keys was mentioned on it. During their stay, we were informed that Woogo had only paid 5 nights to the owner (although my friends had paid 9 nights in advance) and that they were illegal occupants. And I don't even mention the dirty bathroom, the windows that do not close, etc. A real dump! Beware of Woogo!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kyle T
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that i've stayed at this property. For the vaule it is great. I have not ever had the problems with the staff/tenants of the building that others have had. On both ocassions my room has been upgraded at no exta cost to me and the staff have been extremely helpful. The location is great with quick access to subway, a short walk from central park and minimal walk to the museums. The only downside I have is that I don't live in NYC in these apartments!!!!! Going back in August!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: pkoslyn
Reviews.Content: Room and kitchen are serviceable, basic, nothing fancy, some very minor defects like knobs missing from drawers and tiny bathroom. A/c is fine, cannot beat the location! Nice lobby, as long as it's not filled with Gymboree kids and their nannies.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: smfische
Reviews.Content: After reading these reviews, my partner and I called Priceline, and demanded another hotel (afraid of it being illegal/in poor repair/getting locked out). Priceline told us that we should try the hotel anyways, and to call them if we had any problems. Well, maybe they just made an extra effort to make us comfortable because we called, but the hotel was an AWESOME value for the money. It was clean, the room was great (the kitchenette was actually a mini-kitchen), the location was safe, and there is free street parking. It sucks you had to pay more for the internet, and to leave your bags, but we only paid $100 for what we thought was worth at least $160/night. Either the other people who stayed here were snobs, or they gave us amazing treatment after the call in. Either way, check this out for yourself. Great value for the money. Only two bad things happened: we found an apple seed on the floor, and the towel bar in the bathroom fell down. If you're the type of person to be bothered by these things, don't stay here. But, if you're not, we had an amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice and loved it, cheap, good location and apt not too bad”
Reviews.Author: deadlydan
Reviews.Content: Myself, my girlfriend and five of our friends stayed here in march. you get what you pay for in life.Our apt was warm, clean and its in a great location. We stayed in a three bed apt and we had plenty of room, I agree that service was only average but who cares its NYC, all you need is a place to put your head at night. I WILL BE BACK!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump - operated by crooks!!”
Reviews.Author: JordieB
Reviews.Content: Below is a list of problems (all documented with photos!) with the Woogo apartment we rented in Chelsea in Manhattan. It shows blatant disregard of the apartment's functionality, upkeep, and even potentially, resident safety: * The tub filled up with putrid water and did not drain after use. In addition, there appeared to be no overflow cap at the rear of the tub, instead an unfinished and unattractive and vacant hole was present. * The towel bar in the full bath appeared to have been broken off - the cleats were present, but no bar. * The door to the bedroom nearest the front door was held on by only one of three sets of hinges. The other two sets of hinges were hanging loose and no longer attached to the door jam. * The toilet seat in the half bath was cracked completely through. One person in our party received a painful pinch and was actually bruised when she sat on it, because her weight caused the gap in the wood to open, which then closed on her skin when she shifted her weight! * Exposed electrical wires were dangling beneath the cabinetry at three different locations in the kitchen where under-counter lighting should have been or perhaps was intended for future installation. In two out of three instances the wires were capped, but the third had none. I am hopeful that these were not "live" wires, but I was not about to touch them to find out! * Instead of an overhead light in the bedroom closest to the front door, there was a hole and more exposed and capped wires where a ceiling light should have been or perhaps once was. * The apartment had areas of significant wear and tear beyond that which would be considered acceptable for an accommodation of this price. Paint was flaking off in large areas around pull areas of closet doors. Numerous scuff marks were present in every room and the place appeared to be in great need of fresh paint. * The closet that contained the heating/cooling machinery was in a closet in a bedroom and not only was unlocked/accessible, but had the remnants of where a latch/lock formerly had been but had fallen or been broken off. The accommodations were so unacceptable that we had to leave after 1 night because they did not even satisfy our very basic needs (i.e., functional shower), and furthermore the entire process usurped at least 4 hours of our first morning in NYC as we negotiated with staff and looked for last-minute accommodation elsewhere. Disastrous! Insult to injury - they still charged us the full rate for our 1 nite stay AND are adding an additional cancellation fee equivalent to a 2nd nite stay (over $1200 total!). We are in the process of refuting this but have not had any success yet!! These guys are crooks!

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Razvan007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. The location was perfect for what i needed, very close to the subway as well (also the express line). The service was ok, but the room was not so good. The small bathroom smelled like mold (and there was some on the walls indeed). The room door looked unsafe, anybody could have opened that by just nudging a little bit. I know that hotels in NY are generally bad, but this one can do better for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!!! Beware of Woogo”
Reviews.Author: agtemp2
Reviews.Content: Beware of Woogo! My wife and I were recently on vacation in New York City. Our accommodations were handled by ‘woogo’ (www.woogo.com) through Priceline. I hope no one else has to experience what we did at the hands of Woogo. Please, stay away from this company! Here is the timeline and experience: It will tell our side of the story, which woogo.com Carlos and their account manager already know. I can’t believe this has taken so long to correct. April 9th, Priceline.com reserves us an apartment in New York City; the booking states: “The apartment will have a key for the front door for independent access to the building for the rest of the stay”. We book it. When we arrive and buzz, the young lady at the buzzer says “you won’t need a key; we’ll buzz you in remotely.” She assured us that this service was available 24/7, so although we didn’t like it, we didn’t have a choice. Trouble began the second night. Sometime after midnight we returned after having seen “Memphis” on Broadway (by the way: great show). Unfortunately, we had no idea what was in store for us upon our return. We pressed the now familiar buzzer… but nobody was there. Maybe the person was napping, we thought. And we buzzed again... and again... and again… Next we called the contact number my wife had stored in her phone: 212-616-8497. Verizon told us the number was not in service. Uh oh... On the wall of the foyer was “in emergency call …the building super.” Of course, he did not pick up. But his phone had a recording which said, leave your number. So I did. Eventually he called back, but said that he was in Brooklyn and wasn’t going to come up to the upper west side to let in a couple of tourists. His responsibility was to the building, not the renting agent. But he did give us good advice: buzz every apartment in the place, and somebody might let you in. Sure enough, after buzzing the people who live there, and pleading with one woman who actually answered the intercom, someone let us into the building. The apartment itself had a keypad entry, so we were in. The next morning, we tried both the buzzer and the 212-616-8497 number, just to see what had happened the night before. Was their 24/7 pledge really a “get home by midnight or else” rule? No answer on the buzzer, and the phone was still disconnected. Apparently it just didn’t work. Call to Priceline: we need a place to stay! They tried reaching woogo.com also, but the phone was just as disconnected for Priceline as it was for us. They found us a new place, but because we were at the mercy of the market on a big vacation week, we paid about double for a replacement hotel room. Priceline said they’d work out the details with woogo.com. We’re still waiting for this to happen. So here we are a month later, and woogo.com has charged us for three nights, when they only let us in for one night. When I call I get left on hold. When I spoke to the reservations manager, he promised a call back but never did; my return call the next day to the account manager resulted in a 15 minute on hold, before I finally understood the hint and bailed out. They all give the same tired line “I don’t know about this, let me put you on hold to discuss with the next guy in line”. For Priceline: if you can’t screen out shady operators like woogo.com, why should we ever place our trust in you again? Anyone else, if you see a reservation handled by woogo.com, run -don’t walk- away. They’re scammers; incompetent at managing hospitality, and dishonest once they have your money. Don’t let this happen to you!

Reviews.Title: “Dont ever go here!!”
Reviews.Author: jameslover
Reviews.Content: Im a 26yr old male that has been to nyc many times. As soon i arrived there were problems. The front desk was extremely rude. It took 2 HOURS for my room to be ready (i arrived at 5pm). Then we got our room and they literally stuck a bed and a bathroom in a closet and called it a studio. The place was filthy, all the furniture was messed up and old. Seriously messed up my little getaway with my fiance. Thi splace is a total dump and anything you want including the smallest things like a simple room cleaning will cost you a min of 50.00usd. Trust me just go to a hotel with a more creditable name. Dont even both trying to call there main office , there even more rude and place you on hold for atleast a half hour before you speak to the manager. Hell in nyc should be the name.

Reviews.Title: “ok - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: FBIT
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with two friends. The double bed was fine, but the sofa bed was horrendous - imagine the worst sofa bed you can with a metal frame, the odd spring a whole heap of creakiness! Given that the location is quite good it was good value for money. We did not use the kitchen, mostly because the sink smelt quite bad and we were not there long enough. This hotel suited our trip and we got what we paid for with no nasty surprises.

Reviews.Title: “If your not a snob, you'll like it.”
Reviews.Author: davidleigh85
Reviews.Content: Overall it's a good place - good value for money. But, it's a little on the dodgy side: the bed was uncomfortable, the turntable in the microwave didn't work, the 2 bar stools were broken and couldn't be sat on, and there was no hot water for most of 1 of the days. But, in saying that, for what we paid, I was willing to put up with that. On the plus side, the room was big, it cable TV, and a kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Cheflace08
Reviews.Content: Poorly advertise doesn't have a kitchenette it's a hot plate! No Sofa bed...and the staff isn't great at all...We will never look at this place again when in NY

Reviews.Title: “You get what u paid for!”
Reviews.Author: Alexmayson
Reviews.Content: Overall nice apartments for the money we paid! This is not a hotel so there is no room service wake up calls and etc. it has a small kitchenette with microwave, stow and the fridge. Some plates, pans and other tableware available. There is a huge very inexpensive grocery store just next block from the apartment building. We saved bunch of money on food cooking at the room instead of dining out. However there is minimum furniture in the room and bed linen is not really clean good enough. So it might scare u a bit at the beginning. But nothing cost that cheap in this area! It is one block away from the subway, three blocks from Central Park and 15 minutes walking distance from Natural History museum! There are also plenty stores around and places to eat. I would stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “AKA "central park apartment"”
Reviews.Author: ltoakdale
Reviews.Content: Please not the above title, this place also calls themselves by it on booking.com... We traveled to NYC with another couple, and we under the impression we scored a great location/ price for a 2 bedroom apartment for our time in NYC. Upon check in we discovered that we had 2 separate 1 bedroom apartments, and they blame this error/ miscommunication on booking.com... Now everyong know your kinda at their mercey, so we reluctantly accept the individual rooms on seperate floors. The bed was garbage, bathroom toilet seat looked like it was from when JFK was still in office "paint chipped off" For half of the following day the hot water in the shower didn't work. It does have a very nice location to get around the area, but we would've been happier to spend more $ to get exactly what we wanted and not have had to deal with a dishonest establishment on our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: Dennis017
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this place several times and was never disappointed. The rooms are huge by New York standards. They are extremely clean. And my rooms are usually very quiet. (I usually request upper floors in New York to distance myself from the street noise.) The kitchen facilities are a plus so you can have a light breakfast and coffee in the room. A grocery store is convenient, as is a major subway station. Easy walk to Lincoln Center. Don't expect maid service or room service. It is an apartment house. Safe neighborhood. I'll be back there soon.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY: DON&amp;#39;T EVEN THINK ABOUT IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Australian57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Tuesday 21st September 2010. Never look at photos on the deceptive website and think that they bear any resmblance to reality! It is a total lie! Go anywhere else. The beds are so uncomfortable; bathroom tiny but thankfully it was clean. This was a small saving grace. Air conditioning did not work. God forbid being in that tiny airless room in the height of summer! The TV did not work at all. The so called kitchen had no space where you could even slice an apple. The so called baggage area leaves your bags just scattered beside the disinterested staff who sit crammed into a side spot in the foyer. The one good thing: it is located close to L&#39;Este restaurant where we had a superb meal. Otherwise, we loathed, hated, despised this place.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: BekrshireTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is the worse review I will have given to a place in a long while. The first requirement of any hotel is a good night's sleep. Impossible here. The rooms are steaming hot with no way to lower the heat other than opening the windows and letting all the Broadway traffic in, which made it impossible to sleep well. The room furniture is worse than a college dorm rooms, the bed sinks in the middle and is very uncomfortable, the bathroom is as large as a hall closet, the lobby is ratty. Just a bad, bad experience. And I usually give places the benefit of the doubt. One nice thing: it is near the subway so you can make a quick escape!

Reviews.Title: “Scam or Woodo Carma? Our vacation was totally ruined!”
Reviews.Author: niceperson060
Reviews.Content: The following most horrible experience left me speechless and I still cannot believe that this Woogo scam continues almost 2 days after we’ve checked out and decided to never come back. We not only lost the reserved place upon arrival at the property, but also lost time and money risking to be left on the street in NY late at night. In addition, the credit card statement confirmed more than one unauthorized charges from Woogo. I reserved a One Bedroom apartment at their Central Park property at 240 West 73rd St, New York, NY and arrived there at 2 p.m. The front desk lady pulled up the reservation and told us that we could not check in till 3 pm. The reservation confirmation email stated that the check-in times are between 2 and 3 p.m. She allowed our group to keep the luggage at the front desk and come back any time before 10 p.m. to get the room key. We came back before 9 p.m. and were told us that there was a “Situation” with our room and handed us $10 cash for a cab and directed us to Central Park House property, room X, located about 10 blocks away. I confirmed if that was a joke and was told they were serious. Ok, if that was the case and the room was not available even though it was reserved and the credit card balance was confirmed, I was so naïve to believe that going to the new location due to their “Situation” could end the nightmare that was just starting. They even confirmed that there would be someone to let us in at the new location. Upon arrival at the Central Park House (not to be confused with Central Park, which we were initially at) there was not only no one there to let us in (the intercom system was not working properly), but the apartment X was locked and we had no key. I’ve contacted Central Park person and the reservation office. They both were assuring that they are trying to get things resolved. It was already after 10 p.m. Our group was sitting on the steps in front of the locked apartment door thinking that the dirty steps cannot be the place we have to spend our NY vacation night after we paid for the One Bedroom reservation. The late-night Woogo “Phone Resolution Team” kept giving us the non-working access codes to Room X. Finally, one of the codes worked and the door opened….there was someone else in the room. Who knew what could have happened next, but gladly, no one noticed what happened. We were now horrified to death. The night Woogo “Phone Resolution Team” then told us that Room X was not the right room, we were suppose to be entering Room XX, same building. The access codes did not work again, as usual. Following about 40 minutes of such fun, we were told to come back to Central Park property and pick up the key for a room that was ready. I was also told that I will get 15% off for the entire bill. We have to drag ourselves and the luggage back to Central Park and discover that the room/apartment that so magically appeared in the middle of the night was as twice as smaller as the original room that was reserved. Plus, “what 15% discount are you talking about”? Forget the discount that was promised, we were glad to have a place to sleep that night. The next day I’ve discovered more than one charge on my credit card, one greater than the other. Still getting things resolved… Please do not ruin your NY experience by getting involved with this shady Woodo or Woogo business. You may recommend it to only anyone you wanted to play the cruelest joke in revenge for some bad deeds. Other than that, the level of service is horrifying. Scam as it is.

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy establishment, room with multiple defects, careless service, you can do better!”
Reviews.Author: SteveNLaura
Reviews.Content: Location - excellent, short walk to the supermarket, close to subway station, restaurants close. Service - atrocious!!!!!! careless staff who lie to you about fixing room issues, staff have a dodgy feel about them and their motto is close enough is good enough, Room - tiny, many defects: TV broken, air conditioner ineffective, blinds damaged, stove top broken, microwave broken! AND... i think we had a "good" room!! Amenities - nothing for free!! walk down to the Lincoln Centre or McDonalds for free wifi. Value - terrible, very expensive for the poor service, lack of amenities and defective room.. Overall - would not stay here again, avoid like the plague, you can do much better!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE:'MINI-BAR' DEPOSIT $50 PER NIGHT TAKES A WEEK TO GET BACK”
Reviews.Author: AbundantCreature
Reviews.Content: Listen, no one's going to complain about being on the upper west side of NYC, right next to the 72nd station and close to everything Gotham has to offer. When I checked in i was surprised to learn there was a $50 PER NIGHT "deposit" for the mini-bar. Per night, in my case, was $100 for my two night stay. I was just up on a quick meeting from Washington DC and had decided to spend a little time in the city to catch up with old friends. The real clincher was the "mini-bar" itself: a price list tacked on the outside advertised $3.00 per bottle and there were 9 bottles inside (no booze, which was fine for me as I don't have to drink). I spent the first night apologetic because my friend had to foot the bill at dinner and the next morning roaming around searching for a Moneygram (to which the front desk help said "A lot of guests ask about that" when I told him my dilemma). I would have gladly paid for all of the drinks up front (a total of approximately $27). instead i have to wait for "eight to ten business days for the hold to be released on your card". The plumbing in the room was terrible, clogged toilet and bathtub. The light in the bathroom went out and it took them hours to come and repair it even after I had called. The television had a weird buzz that made it impossible to enjoy. The bed was comfortable and the room was very clean. I did not appreciate that I had to leave my room key with the front desk for them to fix the bathroom light and toilet (which still ran all night after they came to 'fix'). As good as the location was, I will never stay there again (and meanwhile I am still waiting for my "mini bar deposit" hold to lift from my credit card).

Reviews.Title: “Beware of "service fees" at booking and check-in.”
Reviews.Author: EngineroSonido
Reviews.Content: Summary: beware of service fees when booking, check-in and during your stay. Great location. Not a hotel. Comfortable small apartments in NYC. This is not a hotel, it is a group of (sparsely) furnished apartments that rent like a hotel, daily, weekly, etc. The building also has permanent residential apartments, so you ride the elevator with tourists and locals together. As long as you go in with these limitations in mind, it's a great value. I grew up in the neighborhood, and this place is in a great location, as advertised. I liked having my own little Upper West Side apartment in a pre-war building (pre-WW2, that is, highly coveted in NYC). I have a 2-year old, and there is a great playground nearby on 76th in Riverside Park. Fairway is around the corner on Broadway, one of NYC's best supermarkets, and Trader Joe's is coming soon to 72nd & B'way. The price is great for the space you get and for the location. However, you do get what you pay for, and there are some shady practices when dealing with this company. Be sure to read all of the fine print before booking, don't overlook the detalls like I did. the bill kept going up and up with each new "service fee". What started as $660 turned into $820 after all the so-called fees. 1. I booked the room through booking.com. Woogo then charged $120 service fee for this! Maybe I missed the fine print, but this is outrageous! 2. When I checked in, they charged a 2.5% fee for paying with a credit card. Say what? It came to be more than $20. "oh, but you're welcome to avoid the fee by paying in cash." right, like I'm going to be travelling with a huge wad of bills, come on now. 3. Who exactly are you renting from? Not Woogo. Not Tempo New York (the actual property). Your credit card is actually charged to Caribbean Sunset Resort, based in Jamaica (the island nation, not the neighborhood in Queens). Nowhere in the booking process is this made apparent. AND, my creidt card company just charged me an international service charge because they are based overseas, even though the card was swiped in NYC! Who are these people? The lady at the hotel's front desk explained it to me this way: Woogo is like Expedia or Travelocity, they are just a booking agency. She would not tell me who Caribbean Sunset is. 4. I called 3 times during the week before to confirm a crib for my baby. When we arrived on a Sat. night after a long day of travel, no crib! They had given it to someone else. Big Problem. After a few frantic phone calls, a friend bailed us out with a crib. I complained, and the next day they went out and bought another crib for us. A nice gesture, but too late. 5. I include a #5 just because I'm mad at them. Just a petty little jab. 6. See #5.

Reviews.Title: “Great - get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: danamiddleton
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to store your bags and lay your head while you spend the days and evenings out doing stuff in NYC, then you can't beat the price of this place. We were 3 girls travelling together for 4 nights. We had a 1 bedroom and got a great price. We always felt safe in the hotel. I shared a bed with one friend and the other slept on the couch. The rooms were clean - yes, they could have used an update, but they were clean, which is all that we cared about. They were hot, as other reviewers have mentioned - but we were there in March and so just opened up the windows. The location was GREAT - just off a subway line at 72nd, literally half a block. And, right at the same place a Grey's Papaya hotdog restaurant (remember Fool's Rush In?). Great hotdogs! We also ate at the pub just down the street on 72nd about 4 storefronts down from the corner which was fantastic. You have to buy wifi, but its worth it and not crazy expensive. I looked online and found cheap parking a couple of blocks over.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Jamie1853
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, nothing like they described in the pictures. The bathroom was like a closet, not to mention the closet space was not good either. You have to pay for everything; cable, Internet, even housekeeping. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, especially when you want to see the sights of New York. The service was just as bad, if not worse, they failed to mention a cover charge of 100$ when you check in (claims it will be returned in a few days) and the lady did not keep track of what she was doing, like she failed to give us the key and didn't remember if we signed a reciept. The air conditioning is horrible in the rooms and throughout the hotel. I would indeed say this was the worst hotel stay I or my boyfriend have ever endeared.

Reviews.Title: “would return visit...”
Reviews.Author: DublinN_p
Reviews.Content: The apartment’s location was great: nice neighbourhood a walk to central park, lots of nice places to eat , a grocery store round corner and express sub way on the door step. I was happy with the apartment, it was decently sized with good wardrobe space, the bathroom is on the compact size but the whole place was very clean and the kitchenette was adequately equipped for our needs. Things I didn’t like; paint work was a bit scuffed bringing down first impression, you also have to pay for internet service, the linen and towels were little worn (but clean and fresh and spares provided) and the a\c was a little noisy but you get used to in and in July you forgive a little noise for a cool retreat. I requested my room cleaning on the day before I wanted it (at half way thru my stay, be aware you only get one service) as instructed by front desk and it was done as requested. I would make a return visit and would I would recommend it, for the price it was everything we were looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Great serviced apartments”
Reviews.Author: Azndude51
Reviews.Content: As long as you know that this place is a serviced apartment and not a regular hotel, you should have a satisfactory stay like I did. The price was very inexpensive for such a large apartment (since you're not paying for all the extra hotel services) and the Upper West Side area is great. There are very few tourists around so you really get a feel for what it's like to be a New Yorker. The location is very convenient, the red 1,2,3 line subway station is less than a block away. That subway line will take you to Midtown/Times Square in about 10 minutes so the major attractions are easy to get to. A cab ride from Penn station cost us less than $20. There is a very large grocery store about 2 blocks away and there are nice shops all over, such as a North Face store that is down the street. The numerous nearby restaurants will suit almost any taste. Also, Central Park is just two blocks over. I stayed here in May with three adult family members while we were on vacation in NY for four nights. We liked the idea of having a two bedroom apartment as opposed to 2 separate hotel rooms. The sofa bed allowed us to split up and so that two of us could essentially have our own room. The two bedroom apartment was spacious considering it was New York and had two baths and a kitchen. There was an air condioner/heater unit in the master bedroom and one in the kitchen/living room area, but the second bedroom didn't have one. The kitchen had modern appliances with a full size fridge, microwave, stove, and oven along with silverware, pots and pans, utensils, cups, etc. Any food for cooking could be purchased at the nearby grocery store. There was a TV with cable but the remote didn't seem to work. The apartment had Ikea furniture but everything was only a couple of years old and it was comfortable enough but not luxurious. Since I am not picky when it comes to beds, I found the sofa bed tolerable and got a decent night's sleep, others may hate it. The sofa had a bunch of nasty looking stains on it but everything else was clean. They had enough towels, sheets, and pillows for 6 people since that is the capacity of the 2 bedroom. As a previous reviewer mentioned, the soap and shampoo are from a large hotel chain but I don't think that's a big deal. The only things that I would've liked in the apartment was a hairdryer and iron and ironing board. Since it was a fairly short stay and my family and I clean up after ourselves well, we had no issues with not having a maid clean our room every night. I didn't use the wireless internet since cost extra, there was no problem finding free wifi elsewhere in the city. Since this is just a serviced apartment building, the customer service is lacking so don't expect much. For example, if you need to print something, they'll just tell you to go to FedEx/Kinkos which is around the block. Also, the reception desk has no one there after around 10 pm but there is an attendant at the front door 24/7. We had to check out at 5am so we just turned our key in to the front door attendant since the reception desk wasn't open yet. The only major issue we had with the apartment was that the top pane of one of the bedroom windows wouldn't stay shut. We didn't feel secure with the window open all the time and it let all the hot summer air in. The maintenance man fixed it within a couple of hours but kept it shut using a couple of screws which seemed kind of dangerous since it was heavy pane of glass. He came back the next day with the manager to see what else could be done about it so they'll probably get it replaced or something. Overall, we had a satisfactory stay. We enjoyed having such a relatively large apartment to stay in and the location was amazing. Since the price was so affordable, we didn't mind that the place didn't have many common hotel services and were willing to look past its issues. It was comfortable enough and we wouldn't mind staying there again if returning to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Not fit for Three but good for Two”
Reviews.Author: indy_family_traveler
Reviews.Content: Central Park West--73rd and Broadway, NYC: I read the reviews that mentioned the terrible sleeper sofa (not possible to sleep on), but since the review was published a while ago, we assumed the owners would have repaired or replaced it by the time we stayed here in late June. Not so! My spouse and I, plus a teenaged son, stayed in this apartment for 4 nights and days, in the "Executive Suite" which indicates it accommodates 3 people. NOTE: IT DOES NOT. The sofa is a two-seater, so you can't sleep on it without using the pull-out sleeper function. The mattress was torn (not to mention stained) with rusty springs sticking out of the fabric that would likely cut you on the legs and thighs. Although he'd had a tetanus shot recently, our son still could not sleep on it without getting pricked or poked by errant wires whenever he moved. Fortunately our son had brought his small sleeping bag--the hardwood floor was preferable to sleeping on that dangerous not to mention disgusting mattress. As everyone pointed out, this is not a hotel so no one should expect concierge service or cleaning for a short stay unless you pay extra. You are renting this due to the location. That said, while the linens smelled clean, they had blood and other unidentifiable stains on them. It can't cost that much to refresh them at Goodwill, right? They already bought the cheapest Ikea furniture available so why not some non-scary linens and pillows? We were only in the apartment for breakfast and sleeping, so the location is the best reason to rent this place. It is so convenient and you just cannot beat the price for the neighborhood. Thus, I am giving this a thumbs up but be forewarned--it only works for two adults who sleep in one bed, unless you have a small child who could sleep on the love-seat sized couch cushion. The mattress is unsafe! So, location, location, location and cheap. We rent apartments all over the world--most recently in Evergreen, Colorado, plus abroad in Tokyo and Banff, and this NYC apartment is the only time we ever had any problems.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and satisfying stay. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: roadsr
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was the biggest eye catcher. It was at walking distance from the shops, the metro (which is a boon) and the Central park. Since it is an apartment hotel, please do not expect it like a typical hotel. The lobby has a front desk where the employee will assist you with any queries etc. Other than that it's a huge apartment with doors on floors leading to different apartments. There is a laundry service at basement with usual coin system. I was a little disappointed with the apartment I was alloted as it was smaller than the one I saw in Expedia. com's visual tour, but I was told since all vary in size, I was given the best available one. Other than that the room was clean and cosy. The small kitchenette was equipped with all the utensils and cutlery that one may need for a short stay and quick cooking. There was a small fridge too. The bathroom was also nice and of good size. But one thing one should know before going there is that there is NO HOUSKEEPING provided. The room is not cleaned, apparently you need to pay extra for the same. We had a little trouble with operating the Kitchenette stove and AC temperature adjustment initially but we were promptly assisted by the hotel staff. Since we were travelling with an infant, the it was very important that we do not have disturbance around the room, which gives 100 points to Woogo as there was completely no disturbance or any noise around. We would not mind repeating Woogo, NY again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location not so great service/room”
Reviews.Author: officerincalopez
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom and it did not at all look like the pictures of the website. They had scratches on the walls, the second television did not work, and the room was depressing. The location is great but the service was not. When I asked for a box for cable for the television that had nothing they said only one of the televisions were for cable and the other was for dvds. They never sent the dvd box after I requested it. Also a fire alarm went off at 2am. When I called the front desk to ask about it they just hung up the phone. When I tried to call back they wouldn't pick up. I never asked for anything extreme just at least the minimum of what a person would expect when they arrive to stay at a place that is paid for (i.e. cleanliness, working televisions, basic customer service). You also have to pay for internet service which in other locations it is free. It is located in a good location but I will never stay at that place again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a great location. Slightly expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Gautzhere
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 20 minutes of brisk walk from 46th street (Times Square) and the Subway station is just around the corner for you to take a train to any place in Manhattan. Slightly expensive. The room had a good air conditioner, Music system, TV, Microwave and minibar (empty though). Did not see a restaurant though . i.e., no breakfast . Helpful, polite and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “It is okay for NYC”
Reviews.Author: gyik
Reviews.Content: It is not really a studio, as there are many furniture items missing. There is no desk/table so if you want to eat you have to do it on the bed or the floor :( There is nowhere to place washed dishes to dry. No reading lights, only one chair. Is is still okay regarding NYC. We stayed on the 16th floor, which was so hot, I couldn't sleep. You have to pay $5/item for luggage store... Ther is no cleaning involved.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price and we had an ironing board!”
Reviews.Author: coalblade
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews and were quite apprehensive but any worry was quickly dispelled. The apartment was basic but what do you expect for the price. Plus we didn't spend all day in it, we were there to see the sights. One thing that has been mentioned in previous reviews which we think would be an improvement is free internet and access to a printer to enable booking online for the flight home. The apartment block was about 200 yards from 72nd Street/Broadway tube station (Red line) and a 5/10 minute walk to Central Park and the Museum of Natural History. The area has a wide variety of restaurants to choose from with a range of prices. We would thoroughly recommend Josie's and Lansky's. It must be reported that cooking would have been a problem as the apartment had only two electric cooker rings (enough to boil a kettle) plus a micowave but we ate out anyway. Additionally, there are loads of shops including Northface, Zara, Urban Outfitters, Apple Store, Loft. The Fairway supermarket is a 2 minutes walk away and an experience in itself for fresh bagels and fruit. We went to the Imax at Lincoln Centre to see Clash of the Titans in 3D but arrived late and ended up pushed to one side so still not sure about 3D.

Reviews.Title: “1 adult and 4 teens, 2 rooms.”
Reviews.Author: talkingtoast
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this apartment, we felt like New Yorkers ! Fairway market is a block away. Coffee from the street vendor in the morning was exceptional. The room didn't have cable TV but numerous street vendors sell dvd's and vhs videos for the kids 2-3 bucks each. you have to pay for internet access. I didn't like how the check in person scanned my CC. I thought it was only my driver license and would have left had he told me he was going to do my cc too. the #3 express train stops at the 72nd street subway station. so one stop from Time Square ! lots of places to eat near.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: EDIEBr
Reviews.Content: No ironing board, no remote for either TV, dim lighting, poor phone sound quality, apathetic staff, extra charge for internet, extra charge for storing luggage - totally not worth the price. All the disadvantages of a hotel or apartment with none of the advantages of either.

Reviews.Title: “Wanna feel like a local, stay here. Great accommodation & location for the price”
Reviews.Author: eLoLife
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel like a real new yorker, this is the perfect place to stay. First of all this is not a hotel. Imagine living in a building with a doorman, that's how it is. (there are actually long term residents) It's a great location. I stayed at a studio apartment with a separate kitchen & bathroom. The bed is pretty big & comfortable. The sheets, the pillows, the comforter were clean and smelled nice. There was enough towels for two & extra sheets. There is a couch, huge tv, stereo, alarm clock, good size closet. The kitchen is pretty comfy with a table and 2 chairs. Everything was CLEAN, the kitchen, the tub, the toilet. The fridge is small. (the supermarket is 1 block away on 74th street, you can just go & buy fresh food everyday, you don't have to stock.) Yes just like someone said in one of his/her reviews they have some other hotel chain's daily care products (I think it was holiday inn), but I figured they bought leftovers from the manufacturer for less price. I don't think it's such a big deal, I never use any of the hotel daily care products anyways. They put $100 hold on your credit card in case you damage something. The day you check out, If you would like to leave your bags at the reception, you have to pay $5 per bag. (I kinda negotiated gave 2 luggages & one carry-on for $10) There was no hairdryer. (I bought one from Duane Reade on 72nd street for $19) didn't really ask them for a hairdryer, so ı do not know if they have it. (if they have, I bet they'd charge you for that as well.) There was a vacuum cleaner & iron. The heater made this horrible sound every nite at certain times, it was as if someone was knocking on the window. Kinda scary but because it wasn't ongoing all nite and I was very tired, I slept through it. (but it's a major issue in the old ny apartments I guess, I remember when I was living in Soho, my heater did make same kinda noise) BUT IT WAS A QUIET ROOM. (there was no outside noise, no cars honking, alarms or sirens) Perfect for people who is not going to spend time in their room, there was no view in my room, the 2 windows both faced a wall, and the kitchen window faced other apartments. (but don't take me wrong it's not claustrophobic. There is no business center; they can't even print out one page but there is a kinkos on 72nd street. There is no free internet, you have to buy it online by using your credit card, it was $10 for 24hrs. Its right on the corner of 73rd and Broadway. By the main subway 72nd street subway station (1-2-3 Lines) There is a huge supermarket (Fairway) on 73rd & Broadway, Duane Reade & Kinkos on 72nd & Broadway. Couple blocks from central park (if you are visiting in the spring, summer or fall, perfect place to walk & run to the park.) There is a Barnes & Noble on 69th & Broadway and a huge movie theatre with Imax. There is shopping as well, you can go to colombus circle or take the train directly to Macy's (34th) or Century 21 (Chambers Street) without transferring to any other line. It's a very safe, beautiful neighborhood. the doormen were pretty nice and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: grunk
Reviews.Content: We took two separate rooms. One was for my husband and myself and down the hall we took another room for our adult daughter, her husband, one infant, and a 3 year old. It was terrific! Our room was very hot, but considering we keep our own thermostat off all winter, it was welcomed heat. The rooms were clean with all the amenities of an apartment. The location can't be beat. You will not get classic hotel service here. (It's an apartment.) If you don't expect it, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made me sick.”
Reviews.Author: mdeloren
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect this hotel to be anything great, but I also did not expect it to be so awful. I knew there would be no room service, which was fine. Upon walking in, everything appeared ok- no obvious dirt or mold, clean towels laid out, clean bathroom. However, after sleeping there one night and seeing the blanket held up to one of the windows, I noticed there was mold growing inside the blanket, undetected until you hold it to the light! Immediately I FREAKED out and brought my own blanket to the room. Later that day I began to feel ill. I now have a terrible, awful cold and I can chalk it up to the room not being cleaned thoroughly. The location is great, right by the subway, and there were some good restaurants in the area. Unfortunately I felt so ill that I went home a day early. Lesson learned: DO invest in a quality hotel room, even if it is just a chain-brand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: moonlighter42
Reviews.Content: We were nervous after some of the more dour reviews and had low expectations when we arrived. We found the room in need of some minor repairs but clean overall. The room was quiet, comfortable and met our needs. The staff was great and accommodating. Reservations, check in and check out were a breeze. The apartments were 1/2 block off the subway and within walking distance to great pizza and two great groceries. For the price we paid, we couldn't have asked for a nicer, better situated room. If you come expecting a modest, city style apartment and don't need luxury, then Woogo Central Park really fits the bill. Thanks Woogo.

Reviews.Title: “Woogo = No Go”
Reviews.Author: bnns
Reviews.Content: Went to NY for a fun family weekend. Woogo has a great location, unfortunately, the rest of their experience is severely lacking. After check-in, a tragi-comedy of events ensued: We put our kids to bed on a mattress on the floor because the pull out sofa bed's metal mattress supports were broken. At 4 AM the next morning, two men entered the apartment using keys and turned on the lights. Seems they saw our children sleeping on the floor, cursed, then ran out of the apartment. This was followed by a security guard knocking on our door looking for someone who apparently worked in the building. We suspect it was the aftermath of the building staff holiday party. In the morning we spoke with both the WooGo staff and the building security about the incident and all claimed ignorance of the event. Of course, the security guard visit to our room was not logged in any report. We have yet to receive any follow-up. Then that evening through the next day, the building was without hot water or heat - too bad considering NYC had a blizzard with a foot of snow. Topping it off, we were awoken at 7AM Sunday morning with a phone call from the building staff asking if we had water in our apartment as the apartment underneath had water dripping through the ceiling. The kicker? Every call to Woogo has started with giving our name, then being put on hold indefinitely. Emails have gone unanswered.We have yet to speak to anyone to voice our issues. Apparently they're not into dealing directly with customer issues. Don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “dissappointing as a place for a familiy holiday”
Reviews.Author: kbergaust
Reviews.Content: The location is great, I experienced this on a business trip last year. I looked forward to bring friends and family here for a holiday, but unfortunately it seems like the simple things you need for a familiy are not taken care of. We did not get a functioning remote control for the livingroom TV, the bedroom TV did not function at all. The staff seems unable to fix this.

Reviews.Title: “It's like living on the UWS”
Reviews.Author: Antoney
Reviews.Content: I wanted to plan a romantic get away with my wife but by the time I started looking for a hotel everything was booked and tiny less than 200 square feet rooms were going for $600. I happened upon the WooGo Midtown location so I booked online. Since I didn't get a confirming email I called the company and was told I didn't have a reservation in the system. The very nice woman who took my call offered to contact her boss to see if she could give me the Central Park Penthouse for the same price of the one bedroom I though I had already booked. She took my name and number and promised to call me back. In less than 20 minutes she called me back and booked the penthouse apartment for me. I started to read some of the prior reviews and was a little concerned that maybe I made a mistake since several reviews were unfavorable. I gained some comfort when I read a recent review which suggested maybe the building was under new management. When I arrived at the apartment building I was pleased with the warmth in the greetings from the staff and even the residents. Two lovely young women were working the check in desk and they were very sweet and helpful. As we went in and out of the apartment building to go shopping, to restaurants and the like, everyone was so friendly, from small children to other couples; everyone was especially nice and inviting. It seemed like each of the security personnel knew we were in the building since they smiled at us in every passing just like they knew us well. We really felt welcomed. What some of the other reviewers didn't notice is that this apartment building is the home to so many really NICE PEOPLE and the staff does a fine job in making you feel welcome. We even got a recommendation from one of the young ladies on staff and she directed us to an amazing cafe were we had a terrific brunch. The room we had was exactly what we wanted. The sitting area was ample and the terrace was spectacular. It was like having our own apartment on the UWS. The kitchen area is small and so is the bathroom but this is typical for Manhattan. The location is nearly perfect. We went shopping for fruit, cheese, wine and other snacks at nearby markets. We walked to trendy and well know restuarants. It was a great experience. We would book this apartment over and over. After having such a great romantic weekend like this I don't know how I could ever go back to a regular hotel for such a special time.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at a friends! Clean, convenient, safe and independent.”
Reviews.Author: chris_trvl13
Reviews.Content: This is an APARTMENT!!! NOT a hotel. There is no "service" besides a doorman who makes sure people don't get in who arent supposed to, but pizza delivery does :) and they will order an airport transfer for you if needed.They have kitchen facilities and a grocery store close buy. Its one block from the 72nd street subway with access to the Main routes #1 and #2 express. There is an awsome restaurant for breaky less than 2 blocks away and a Loehmans for shopping the same distance. You feel like a resident for sure staying here. There is the cutest Tea Shop not far called Alice's Tea Cup (wicked scones, but no coffee). WARNING the Futons ARE NOT COMFY but are bearable....just sayin....

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: OzFamily50
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 2 small children to be near friends on Upper West Side - so location was perfect and as other reviews have noted, this is a great part of NYC for local shops, restaurants and proximity to midtown and transport options. The room on level 17 was basic but clean. There was a huge outdoor deck that we didn't really use and the single bathroom was very cramped - a generous sized person would find it difficult to use the toilet ! The most disappointing thing about the Woogo is that you feel that with just a little attention to detail this could be much better value for money. Sofa bed was uncomfortable and wouldn't suit adults. Sheets and pillows were very poor quality and the bathroom soap pinched from a competitor was a unique touch ! ? Probably would try somewhere else next time for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean enough”
Reviews.Author: MaxPsdn
Reviews.Content: Location, very near (1,2,3) metro: Only 5-10min to Times Square and 10-15min PennSt [->Macy´s] / Tribeca / Soho. 900m/10 min to Lincoln Center by foot. Also near Central Park, Dakota, Strawberry Fields. Nearby many not over-priced good restaurants, Fairway-market (excellent grocery) & other services. Very nice neighbourhood. We had 17th floor penthhouse w/1 bedroom, spacious living room (with lcd tv), huge roof top terrace with beautiful skyline + bathroom. Next to famous and historical Ansonia building. Small, good enough kitchenette: coffee maker, fridge. Clean - small bathroom, but OK. Check in/out fast. Reception ordered taxi back to JFK, but no actual "overall service" (which we didn´t need). Open 8am-10pm, but 24/7 security.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no frills, felt like a NYC resident”
Reviews.Author: angelstar0614
Reviews.Content: This location is at 72nd and Broadway. Right around the corner is the subway stop so it is extremely convenient (and one of the reasons why we picked this place). The room was larger than we had thought based on previous reviews - adequate space for a double bed, small couch (not the most comfortable fold-out bed, but it worked), and a small kitchen with a counter. The closet was roomy and nearly a walk-in, and the bathroom was small but clean. There was a normal sized shower, small sink (no counter space unfortunately) and a toilet - the basics, essentially. The room had a large TV and a small dining table with two chairs as well as an ottoman. The view we had on the 6th floor was of the building across the street. We were woken up most of the days by 7:30 because of a garbage truck making constant noise. The only other complaint we had was that you had to request cleaning either very early in the morning the day you want it or have to wait another day, so we never got our room cleaned that week. Note this is not hotel-like service where you have automatic cleaning. This worked for us though. Overall we felt like long-term residents of NYC with a mini-apartment to go home to at the end of the day!

Reviews.Title: “If you expect service No. If you want convinience Yes.”
Reviews.Author: medellino1
Reviews.Content: Rather no frills. It is in a good location on Broadway and 73rd just next to the subway. Rooms feature a kitchenette. Bath had no plug but didn't mind as I could still shower. Was convinient that I didnt have to constantly buy food. I could simply reheat ( 3 weeks I was here) in the microwave and had a fridge and bits and pieces. Bed was ok but couldnt adjust aircon. Though the building is almost 100years old I think, just check the plaque next to the entrance. Would stay here again for the convinience with my long term stays and its location. But for some luxury and someone to look after your stay, thats what a true hotel is for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Xantia81
Reviews.Content: My friend and i booked our hotel online and was very exited to see if the room would look like in the pictures. And i can only say id did. The room was clean, with a nice bathroom and walk in closet. The staff was friendly and helped us storage our luagage for three days while we were on a small trip to Niagara Falls. The only remark was that they didnt change our towels and sheets for the 7 days we where there. Overall i can only say that it was a good hotel and definitly our mony worth.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room ,clean, friendly staff, safe,comforatble”
Reviews.Author: carolingnurse4
Reviews.Content: I've read the neagative reviews and either the management is new altogether or has changed. I stayed for 16 days with my mother and teenage daughter. When we checked in, the lobby was average in appearance at best and we were a little concerned. We were still concerned when we stepped off the elevator into the hall. The appearance was fine but it was warm and humid and a little musty smelling. When we opened the room to our apartment, it was beautiful. It had hardwood floors and the whole apartment had a fresh smell. Everything worked well: A/C, plumbing, kitchen appliances. The staff was super friendly and accomodated every request in a prompt manner. They suggested restaurants, gave us tips for negotiating New York, and we felt very secure with a 24 hour front desk. They even saved us from missing our flight when we did not notice that our shuttle vouchers required a 24 hour pre-scheduling. The lady at the front desk personally flagged down a mini van taxi to take us to the airport. The price could not be beat! Very convenient section of the city, Upper West Side. One block from 1 train and minutes from extraordinary restaurants and shopping

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Colerocks
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my wife last Feb. for a weekend. The Woogo is everything they say it is - a no frills hotel. Don't expect the NY Palace. Expect a decent room, in a nice area, a great location at an amazing price. Virtually all of the bad reviews are from people who expected a full service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Katiemolly1
Reviews.Content: We visited new york for our joint birthday celebrations and stayed in the woogo, and we found it fine, the reception staff were young guys who were extremely helpful and pleasant. The room was a studio and was an ok size, felt very much "new york" and it was handy having the kitchen area. We felt safe here, and it was clean, the subway is just along the road and its right near the dakota building and strawberry fields part of central park. There is a great diner near the subway which i cant remember the name but its next to a card shop and florist, and it is like walking into a film set of 60,s NYC, and they do great bagels and coffee. We enjoyed our stay here and yes there are probably hotels more plush in the city, but we will defo be going back to stay at Woogo.

Reviews.Title: “Never again - came back to find all my stuff gone”
Reviews.Author: rutlanderUk
Reviews.Content: I flew over from the UK and arrived needing a shower. There was no hot water. when they told me it was coming in half an hour it took an hour and then it was filthy. i filled a glass of it and couldnt see through it! next morning still no water! went to a wedding the next night and returned at 130am to find all my stuff had been put away in the luggage room including my wallet and passport. they had thrown all my stuff in a case and because there is no one there after 10pm i had to sleep in my underwear and could not shower as all had gone. had wifes medication in case and when i informed security guard he told me that if she got worse i should take her to hospital. an excuse of a hotel. the people who run the desk are young, imature and rude and dont expect to be treated nicely there. their call centre is also a nightmare and no one ever wants to take any form of responsibility.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: rugernaylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2008 and were more than happy with our apartment, from what I gather standard of places to stay in New York aren't very high, maybe our expectations were quite low however we were more than happy with our apartment to be honest who spends a lot of time in their rooms when staying in New York. I would reccommend this place to friends & family!

Reviews.Title: “You get out what you put in!”
Reviews.Author: caz197
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this hotel through expedia. Only paid £500 for 6 nights, which at new York prices, this is an exceptional price. Ofcourse the pictures didnt really reflect the size or quality of the room, however it was a good base. The room didnt really have much natural light and it was very small, but the location really made it value for money and the rooms were clean! Bonus having a fridge. We used the location productively and visited a few bars nearby on Amsterdam avenue. Its also very close to central park (One of the best places on earth!) Also Sarabeths, which is a famous breakfast venue! Yummy ! If your all about the dinosaurs like me, then the natural history museum is closeby too. use the card machines for your tickets. I would recommend this place if you are a younger couple ( not meaning to be agest) No frills, but if you want frills and glamour stay at the ganesvoort!.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: jonnyrnb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at woogo central park apartments, I was checked right in, my room was great, I thought I would have to sleep in the same room as my colleagues but there was a seperate room for me. I felt safe knowing there was 24hr security. The location was great too, the 2 train was right out of the hotel, it was a great experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough...”
Reviews.Author: aml518
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this for a short-term NYC stay, but if you're staying for a longer period of time and looking for a cheap place, this is it. We were only here for 2 nights, and I wish I spent the extra money to get a nice hotel. That said, the location is great - very close to the subway and within a walkable distance to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy - Avoid!!”
Reviews.Author: Oarolian
Reviews.Content: Booked a studio apartment on Hotels.com only to find out on arrival that there "was no record of my reservation..." Seems to be a trend with this place based on other reviews! Hotels.com were helpful in booking another place but shouldn't have got to that situation. Avoid this dodgy company!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: Tpatrick87
Reviews.Content: The Woogo is clean and comfortable, what more could you want in New York City? If you only stay in your room I guess you would want more extravagant accomodations, but for the price, the Woogo is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand bad reviews, loved it”
Reviews.Author: hardcor
Reviews.Content: Woo go is a great place to stay if you want a reasonabll cheap place to stay in NY. Very close to subway, three minute ride to Times Square, great supermarket down the road. Can't understand bad reviews. This place is NOT a hotel. If you want room service and your bed made up everyday, book into one! It's like a little home away from home. Make sure you ask for an upper floor, no noise!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: devlin123
Reviews.Content: Very nice apartment, when I will return to New York will stay here again. The apartment was within my budget, cheap compared to some of the similar accomadation in Manhattan. The staff were very friendly and the location was very good, residental and very friendly . Only a short subway ride away from times square and all the other must see attractions in New York yet not to close to all of the madness either. The rooms in the apartment were very nice, its really up to yourself how clean you keep them, however in our 2 weeks stay we did get it cleaned twice. All in all, a very nice experience, especially given the price.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING”
Reviews.Author: JUDESARAMA
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump, the service is zero, they charge your card without permission, i am still chasing up charges made to my card by them not authorized. The boiler pipes bang against the walls all night and keep you awake, the heater in my lounge room wouldn't work, when i used the power point in kitchen or bathroom the power would trip out and go off. BE VERY Careful. No assistance you keep getting told to talk to ANNA and anna never helps and just never really replies,,, although i bet she is busy with accounts. We are taking action through the appropriate channels to get our money back from them. They still owe me deposits they never have paid back. DODGY DODGY

Reviews.Title: “okay for what it was”
Reviews.Author: phoebendan
Reviews.Content: Booked through expedia and we were only there for one night and were not expecting the red carpet. We got in late and left very early. The neighborhood was beautiful and quiet (for big city). We were a bit north of the touristy area but a train, a block away, did a non stop drive to the times square area. The hotel was not too hard to find and had a bit of a sterile appearance. The front desk had a minimal school like desk and the staff was more interested in clock watching than serving. I was to leave my credit card info with them and was a bit hesitant about that but it all worked out. The room was okay, bathroom was clean but tiles chipped and so on. Don't expect to get an extra towel or special treatment unless someone happens to know where they are kept and someone is on the clock to get them. Like I mentioned we were only there for the night and it was okay for the price I found.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be worse”
Reviews.Author: jfdiii
Reviews.Content: There was no heat and the windows did not shut properly. This means that we had a 50 degree night. My wife, who was coming to Sloan Kettering for a cancer treatment, had to spend the night sleeping with her coat on. In the morning, there was no hot water. So we went to the hopital with no shower. I called and complained. But they lied. Do not go there. These are bad people

Reviews.Title: “Veyr good quality, price and location in center”
Reviews.Author: bkujanova
Reviews.Content: Hi, I really recomend this nice LARA GROUP apartment in New York City. It has very good location in city centre - 5 minutes by walk from Central Park, 50m from Subway station. Our apartment has been very clean and comfortable for 3 person. (see attached pictures) You have to pay full payment in advance but don´t worry, there wasn´t no problem. Beata Kujanova

Reviews.Title: “Woogo - Terrible place”
Reviews.Author: janefromireland
Reviews.Content: Hello, Recently stayed in Woogo. We were a party of three adults so booked a one bedroomed apartment. When we arrived it was between nine and ten in the evening. There was no bed linen supplied for the sofa bed. I went downstairs to request some and was told "come back tomorrow - it's not my problem" by the woogo employee responsible for checking people in and out. Eventually, when I refused to leave the lobby without bedlinen he got the message. How he thought we could sleep with no bed linen is beyond me. He was rude, unhelpful - and it was a simple request - can we please have some sheets and some duvets/slumberdowns for the sofabed. The sofabed mattress was thin and not comfortable, i.e. springs and bars stick into you, we ended up sleeping on the floor on sofa cushions because it was so uncomfortable. The bedroom had no door - when we enquired why there was no door, we were told that "it ws designed that way". The door frame had hinges still attached, so that seems unlikely. The bedroom with no door was right next to the kitchenette, so a door would have been nice. My husband found a cockroach but these are common in NYC. Noise - unbelievable noise every second morning at around 5am. This was caused by rubbish collection, our apartment was right at the front of the building so we dreaded the early morning wake up call. We requested several times to be moved, finally one nice member of staff offered to move us, but this was after five days and nights of requesting it. We were there for a week - when we requested that our apartment be cleaned we were told it would have to wait a day. That is a joke - they don't tell you they need two days notice to clean the apartment. Left luggage on checking out - they charge you five dollars a bag that you want to leave . We only stayed in Woogo because our other apartment booking fell through. I would NOT recommend woogo. Go to NY for a shorter period and stay in a hotel. The location is great, but the staff there are rude and unhelpful and if you are relying on a sofabed - you are in for an uncomfortable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at All - Ignore the Other Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Keesapullo
Reviews.Content: I booked the room thru hotels.com. Since it was the off season, I paid a reasonable price. This hotel does not provide everyday cleaning, sheet replacing service. So if that is what you want, pay the extra $200 and spend it at another hotel. The location is great, a couple of blocks from the subway. A huge grocery store close by. My family stayed 4 days, and we made most of our meals in the fully supplied kitchen. Let me mention that I grew up in NYC, so I may be biased. I didn't need much attention from the hotel staff, because you will not get any. As long as I had a bed and clean room that was all I needed. NYC is very expensive and trust me when I say that you should save your money for site seeing rather than a hotel room.
